page.title: 14CHURCH LIFE IN SHROTON
page.content: THE RECTOR TAKES ALL THE SERVICES AND DRIVES TO SHROTON FROM IWERNE MINSTER WHERE HE LIVES. SOMETIMES HE COMES TO CHAT WITH PEOPLE TO TELL THEM ABOUT THE CHURCH. THERE ARE USUALLY QUITE A FEW PEOPLE AT THE SERVICES BUT NOT ENOUGH TO FILL THE CHURCH COMPLETELY. THE FAMILY SERVICE IS POPULAR. WE SING ABOUT 4 HYMNS AND SAY A FEW PRAYERS. THEN A HELPER TELLS A STORY TO ALL OF THE YOUNGER CHILDREN THAT HAS SOMETHING TO DO WITH THE BIBLE. AFTER THAT ALL THE YOUNG CHILDREN GO TO THE CRECHE. IN OUR LAST HYMN WE HAVE A COLLECTION OF MONEY AND THE TREASURER CHOOSES TWO OLDER CHILDREN TO DO IT. THEN THE RECTOR TELLS US ABOUT THE OTHER SERVICES DURING THE WEEK. THE CHRISTMAS SERVICE IS ALMOST THE SAME BUT ALL THE CHILDREN LIGHT CANDLES TO PUT ROUND THE CRIB. WE HAVE ONE SERVICE A WEEK USUALLY.
